bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 22 (Tuesday, February 10, 2015)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. POLIS:H.R. 846.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 3 of section 8 of Article I of the Constitution[Page H918]

item.name: Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education Subcommittee

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.name: Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education.
Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

item.fullName: Rep. Carney, John C., Jr. [D-DE-At Large]

summary.text:
Student Non-Discrimination Act of 2015

Prohibits public school students from being excluded from participating in, or subject to discrimination under, any federally-assisted educational program on the basis of their actual or perceived sexual orientation or gender identity or that of their associates.

Considers harassment to be a form of discrimination.

Prohibits retaliation against anyone for opposing conduct they reasonably believe to be unlawful under this Act.

Authorizes federal departments and agencies to enforce these prohibitions by cutting off the educational assistance of recipients found to be violating them.

Allows an aggrieved individual to assert a violation of this Act in a judicial proceeding and recover reasonable attorney's fees should they prevail.

Deems a state's receipt of federal educational assistance for a program to constitute a waiver of sovereign immunity for conduct prohibited under this Act regarding such program.

bill.title: Student Non-Discrimination Act of 2015

item.title: To end discrimination based on actual or perceived sexual orientation or gender identity in public schools, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
